refnamediv.refpurpose: Combines images from several raytracing techniques to produce complex images.

refsection.para: rtwizard is a tool that automates the use of several BRL-CAD graphical programs to produce complex images. There are two primary modes of operation - a graphical client to guide users through the process of creating images, and a command line mode to allow users who already know what options they wish to use to quickly and automatically produce images. There are two modes - graphical mode is used when insufficient information is supplied to produce an image (unless an option specifically ruling out graphical mode is passed) and command line mode (used automatically when there is enough information to produce an image, unless GUI mode is specifically requested.) When in graphical mode, rtwizard is self explanatory. This manual documents the command line options available when not operating in graphical mode.

listitem.para: Specifying the geometry database containing the objects to be raytraced.
The name (and image format) of the final output image generated by rtwizard.
Run rtwizard's graphical interface, even if the command line options specify enough information to produce an image.
Run rtwizard on the command line, even if the command line options do not specify enough information to produce an image. Overridden by --gui option if both are specified.
Specify objects to render using full color.
Set the background color to use when raytracing full color objects. May use R/G/B or hex style color specification.
Specify objects to be rendered using ghosting.
Control the degree of visibility to use when rendring ghost objects.
Specify objects to render edges with using rtedge.
Specify color to use when rendering edge lines. In addition to R/G/B and hex color specifications, the keyword "region" is also supported - in the latter case, region colors will be used for lines.
Specify color rtedge will use for non-line rendering.
Specify the occlusion mode rtedge will use for line rendering.
Specify the type of image to be rendered. This is optional, but if a type is specified and insufficient information is supplied to generate that particular image type, rtwizard knows to error out.
Read model2view matrix from standard input. Conflicts with -a and -e options
Specify the maximum number of processors (in a multi-processor system) to be used for this execution.

refsection.para:
The images produces by rtwizard are categorized by picture type - there are six picture types built on full color raytracing, ghosting (greyscale raytraced images partially faded into the background) and line renderings based on rtedge outputs. Those types are:
Simple Full-Color Image
Simple rt raytrace.
Simple Line Drawing
Simple rtedge raytrace.
Highlighted Image
Color rt raytrace enhanced with rtedge output.
Mixed Full-Color and Edges
Mix of rtedge and rt rendered components.
Ghost Image with Insert
Combination of full color rt raytracings and faded greyscale raytracings, produced by...
Ghost Image with Inserts and Lines
Combines all available rendering techniques in one image - most complex.
Numerous error conditions are possible, usually due to errors in the geometry database. Descriptive messages are printed on stderr (file descriptor 2).
